etymologies: mid 19th century (in the sense ‘showing discernment’): from Latin discriminant- ‘distinguishing between’, from the verb discriminare (see discriminate)

definitions: an agent or characteristic that enables things, people, or classes to be distinguished from one another

examples.text: anemia is commonly present in patients with both conditions, and is therefore not a helpful discriminant

definitions: a function of the coefficients of a polynomial equation whose value gives information about the roots of the polynomial.
shortDefinitions: function of coefficients of polynomial equation whose value gives information about roots of polynomial
